channel.title: cc on Nathan R. Yergler
channel.description: Recent content in cc on Nathan R. Yergler

item.title: Nostalgia
item.description: I read that 2018 was the final year of Open Source Bridge.

item.title: Minor update for OpenAttribute
item.description: I’ve just pushed a minor update to OpenAttribute to github .

item.title: Licenses & Attribution in Firefox: OpenAttribute
item.description: Seven years ago I started working on MozCC, an add-on for Firefox that exposed Creative Commons license information embedded in web pages.

item.title: CI at CC
item.description: I wrote about our roll-out of Hudson on the CC Labs blog .

item.title: CiviCon Plenary: What Are We Paying For?
item.description: I’m spending part of my day today at the first ever CiviCon , a one day conference for the CiviCRM community.

item.title: Back to the Future: Desktop Applications
item.description: One of the best prepared talks I saw at PyCon this year was on Phatch , a cross-platform photo processing application written in Python.

item.title: CiviCon Next Month in San Francisco
item.description: I’m honored to be asked to kick off the first ever CiviCon next month in San Francisco .

item.title: Pre-read: Grok 1.0 Web Development
item.description: |image0| Late last month I received an email from Packt Publishing (en.

item.title: i18n HTML: Bring the Pain
item.description: I have to stay up a little later this evening than I’d planned, so as a result I’m finally going through all the tabs and browser windows I’ve had open on my personal laptop.

item.title: Houston Connexions
item.description: I spent the first half of this week in Houston, Texas for the Connexions Consortium Meeting and Conference .

item.title: Thoughts on Deploying and Maintaining SMW Applications
item.description: In September or October of last year, I received an email from someone who had come across CC Teamspace and was wondering if there was a demo site available they could use to evaluate it.

item.title: “Actions” for SMW Applications (Hypothetically)
item.description: Talking about AcaWiki has me thinking some more about our experiences over the past couple years with Semantic MediaWiki , particularly about building “applications” with it.

item.title: Caching WSGI Applications to Disk
item.description: This morning I pushed the first release of wsgi_cache to the PyPI, laying the groundwork for increasing sanity in our deployment story at CC .

item.title: AcaWiki: On Building Emerging Applications
item.description: I’m woefully late in noting the launch of AcaWiki .

item.title: gsc Bug Fixes
item.description: I announced gsc earlier this week because it worked for me.

item.title: git-svn and svn:externals
item.description: UPDATE I’ve pushed a few bug fixes; see this entry for details.

item.title: Open Access and Linked Data
item.description: I traveled to the midwest late last month and made a few stops, including PyCon and a brief visit with my parents.

item.title: Unicode output from Zope 3
item.description: The Creative Commons licene engine has gone through several iterations, the most recent being a Zope 3 / Grok application.

item.title: Technology Summit
item.description: Yesterday was the first ever Creative Commons Technology Summit , hosted at Google.

item.title: Avoiding git PTSD
item.description: In an attempt to prevent additional git (or maybe just git-svn?

item.title: Getting Things Zero’d
item.description: I really love task lists — especially the crossing off part — but lately they haven’t really been helping me out.

item.title: OpenWeb 2008 Slides
item.description: As promised, slides for my OpenWeb talk, Deploying the Semantic Web with ccREL and RDFa, are available .

item.title: OpenWeb 2008 Vancouver
item.description: I’m in Canada (O!

item.title: Technology Internships at Creative Commons
item.description: If you don’t read the Creative Commons blog, you missed the announcement that the deadline for applying to be a CC intern this summer has been extended until March 21 (a week from Friday).
